website_summaries.verdict: The B-hyve Faucet Timer is competent enough to make up for its flaws, given that it's one of your only options for adding smarts to an ordinary garden hose.
pros: The Orbit B-hyve Faucet Timer is easy to install and easy to use
It works with Amazon's Alexa and monitors the local weather to help you set a watering schedule
Most importantly, it makes smart watering more accessible than its competition by working with a basic hose and faucet setup
cons: The B-hyve app doesn't offer enough customization for the different plants you might be watering with your garden hose, limiting how smart it can be
It also doesn't offer any middle ground between smart and manual scheduling

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and easy to install but please work on the app.
customer_reviews.text: I have waited for this product for a while. I bought three (3) faucet timer and one (1) wifi hub. It took me 10 to 20 minutes to hook it up and it is easy enough for everyone else but the app can be a bit confusing... Hardware: So far so good! I've probably lost connection maybe once or twice since it has been connected to my wifi. (about 3 weeks ago now). I can always switch to bluetooth (if I'm range) if wifi does not work. Overall great product so far. Please work on the app! Less click and more information will be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Clement Batut

customer_reviews.title: No phone support for defective product
customer_reviews.text: I was shipped a defective WiFi hub unit. When I plug it in there is no indication that it's alive. I would have loved to explain this to a phone support person and get the problem resolved, but after sitting in the Que for 38 minutes I moved on. 38 minutes of listening to a stupid message repeating that I can get help on the website. How stupid do you think I am? How many times do you think I need to hear the same message repeated in my 38 minute wait? Can the website diagnose a defect and authorize a replacement? I'm angry and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brawn

customer_reviews.title: Really nice and expensive paperweight
customer_reviews.text: A really nice and expensive paperweight, the hub never connected to my account, when I finally figured out, the bhyve app showed me a message saying it was unable to register and asked me to call the bhyve support call center. They never answer (tried for several days and hours), and you must call them M-F on business hours, forget about calling when you are out of the office. The good thing is that it can hold big papers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like this, but it just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I was cautiously optimistic when I made this purchase because of the reviews. They were right. Pairing the hub and the timer was terribly difficult. It took me almost an hour to get them to pair, working with outlets in 3 different rooms, with different wall orientations to the outside timer component. I bought this because I was going to be traveling for a long time over the summer and didn't want my plants to die. Unfortunately, the connection between the two pieces constantly dropped. I ended up having a family member come over once and week and manually turn faucet on. This is a very unreliable product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cox

customer_reviews.title: You'll Regret It - Trash
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. I've tried bunches of batteries and it continues to say batteries are dead. It will not run the test or even let me turn it on manually. I've watched hours if YouTube videos and read every post I could find. Glad I can still return this giant waste of money. Time to buy a 20 dollar one that I'll probably replace next year but actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Guy

customer_reviews.title: No product support by company listed in return information
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to install and worked great for about 2 months. It then started disconnecting to the internet and couldn’t be controlled. The product support information provided is incorrect and we are now stuck with an expensive piece of useless equipment. This was our second purchase...the first one had no issues and is still working great!
customer_reviews.author: Cheese Lover

customer_reviews.title: Works, but eats batteries for breakfast
customer_reviews.text: This thing eats batteries. Also I don't know why the button on it doesn't just start the hose manually. Bit annoying to have to use the app when I'm standing right next to it. Brand New Duracell batteries last about 3 weeks with a sprinkler running every 3 days. Sucks, but oh well, won't need it as often in winter. The app is okay. I have both the bhyve sprinkler controller and the faucet. The app keeps them both seperwte which is annoying to switch between.. Minor.
customer_reviews.author: SimpsonsTX

customer_reviews.title: How to waste a Sunday!!
customer_reviews.text: I guess it works okay with the android app once you get it set up. the app is a little hard to navigate and understand sometimes. The biggest problem is that it does not work with Alexa for many people. I didn't find that out until mine did not work and I searched for answers at which time I discovered there where quite a few people having the same issue and no support for the issue on the B-hyve FAQ page, Just a lot of people asking what to do. I will be returning this one and buying the Link Tap:
customer_reviews.author: esspea

customer_reviews.title: Not able to bridge multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: If I was just rating ease of installation, setup and use of one device, I would have given the product five stars. I purchased five of them for a drip system I installed for the whole yard. The advertising indicates that multiple devices can be bridged and controlled together. Nope! Each has to be set up on its own program, controlled independently from one another. I got on a user review site (too late!) and saw complaints about this that went back to 2018. At first Orbit's tech department responded that a fix was in the works, now they don't even reply to the posts. And Orbit makes it impossible to reach a live person in Customer Service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to my Smart Home
customer_reviews.text: I love the b-hyve timers. They are smart. The Hub connected easily. Setup was easy. The app is easy to use. Love the fact that the timer will put itself into 'Rain Delay' depending on what I set for Percent of Chance, Amount of rain, and even Wind. I found an add-on for SmartThings so I can also monitor from the SmartThings app. This also gave me the ability to view the battery level in ActionTiles. I ended up buying another timer to add to this set. Next season, looking to add at least two more.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney N. Schoolcraft

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: The set up was very easy and the timer has functioned very well. It is easy to switch from timed to manual on demand water. The only feature that does not work is the gallons used feature - I think it may be a feature that they are planning on having because it doesn’t exist now. The tech support suggested that I just time filling a bucket..not the high tech answer if was hoping for. I would recommend that they delete this as an advertised feature until they actually implement it. Very satisfied otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: The wifi hub had been set up before.
customer_reviews.text: The wifi hub can not be found by the bhyve app. It appears it was previously set up and no code was provided. I called orbit and was told to press the button under the b on the wifi connector 5 times to put it into pairing mode and then I had to indicate I wanted to assume ownership of the Hub. It is now working well. There is no documention on pressing the button 5 times to force it into pairing supplied in the documentation or online. I do like Orbit's products.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Vette

customer_reviews.title: Says its NEW, clearly sent me USED
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of the product... but I couldn't even get past step 1! I was clearly sent a used unit. It says every that batteries are not included... well, mine already had 2 AA batteries in it. I tried to do step 1, which was plug in the HUB to pair it to my app... HUB turns on, then goes right back off. Phone can never find the HUB. Pretty upset! I've been in the hospital since it was delivered, and was pretty excited to get home and hook it up, and I can't. I will be figuring out how to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: It only lasted 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great and worked perfectly for a few weeks, unfortunately wont last more than a few months. This device stayed in a shaded weather protected area and still didnt last more than a few months. The first symptom it wouldnt water on scheduled programs, then it would start getting disconnected constantly. I decided to buy just the timer to try to see if I have better luck. Otherwise keep an eye on it if you have one or avoid this product completely it has terrible support.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Almost non- functional with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I decided to ditch my “dumb” water timers in hopes that this would work by using voice commands through my Amazon echo device. The set up is relatively simple and everything is functioning through the app but when it comes to voice commands the device will only turn the water off and will not turn the water on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far the best thing on the market
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review back in 2018 that wasn't so complimentary. They have changed the software and it is all working great with all four valves. I'm really impressed. It totally beats the hell out of anyting Melnor has to offer. If you're putting in a single valve with the Hub it's a piece of cake but adding additional valves presents some problems. I currently have four valves on one faucet distribution device. Things become a little bit more complicated BUT you have some very excellent people just a phone call away. Lou, one of the technicians even programmed my four valves directly from his office. All I had to do was ask, I was very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Fichtl

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just plain junk. First off, it malfunctioned while I was on vacation and pretty much ran 14 hours a day while I was gone. My water bill was over $300 because of this thing. The company offered no assistance except to send me another timer. Now, I am trying to setup the new timer and need to call them but today is a Saturday and they are only open Monday - Friday.. Do yourself a favor and stay away. There are better timers on the market..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Watering Schedule
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to set up and the interface is logically interactive. After reading most of the reviews on Amazon, I wasn't sure that it was going to do the trick - but it has exceeded our expectations. We have set it up with a schedule to water the lawn every evening. The interface connects with local weather, so if it rains, the daily watering is skipped. A message is sent that watering has been skipped and scheduled watering will take place on the next scheduled day. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: John P. Coates

customer_reviews.title: Can't connect to hub.
customer_reviews.text: The app says "Cannot find device. Ensure your Hub as powered on" It is powered on. I tried factory resetting the hub, reinstalling the app, resetting the device on the website. Nothing worked. The Customer Care link on their website is completely worthless too. Seems like this problem has existed since at least 2018 and that you have to call tech support and have them manually remove the device from your account. How has this not be addressed yet? Sending it back along with the 2 additional hose timers I bought with this.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Too “smart” for me.
customer_reviews.text: The hardware seems fine but the control app is terrible. They tried to give it all sorts of “smart” features and made it virtually impossible to turn them off. I just wanted it to work as a timer valve that I could also remotely control, but it keeps deciding not to turn on the water on schedule for reasons of its own. I’ve turned off “smart” watering in three different places but it still skips at will. Then the wifi gateway stopped connecting to my WiFi network. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: MikeAnt

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: The app and the setup process is absolutely atrocious. They have an android app but it doesn't work to pair devices. This company should put in a disclaimer that says DOES NOT WORK WITH ANDROID instead of wasting people's time. I even spoke to their technical support and he said "At this time it doesn't work but we are working on a fix". Turns out they've been working on that supposed fix for months. Don't waste your money if you have an Android device and if you have an apple device be prepared for horrible support, bad connectivity, and an app that appears to have been coded by children.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Radloff

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, horrible product.  Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Such a horrible, unreliable product. The hub will not stay on my WiFi network. Yes, I have excellent WIFI coverage well beyond my property line. I can only interface with the time via Bluetooth. WIFI hub is just unreliable. Here's the kicker- I've scoured the Orbit website to look for a user manual. They don't exist. Just a quick video of the basics. I should have known not to buy a wireless device from a sprinkler head company. Hey Orbit...make this right. I tried to call the help number, but there is a one hour wait. Dont give me COVID crap, everyone else is working from home.
customer_reviews.author: EOS Man

customer_reviews.title: Product is good, the Company is excellent!
customer_reviews.text: The operation, and the fit / finish of the product is top-notch! I believe the user interface at least the Android app, is too cludgy and could / should be streamlined for it easier use. However, the factory provides excellent service and was certainly willing to take the time to answer my questions and to walk me through some of the confusing set up. When trying to reposition and use on a different location, I ran into problems again, but this time it turned out to be a product defect. The factory shipped a new unit out immediately! Their (Orbit) response and attitude is exemplary. We now look for and specify the Orbit name brand on our jobs!
customer_reviews.author: I-Fly4Fun

customer_reviews.title: What a joke!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a pain to connect when I first got it. After a short month of use, it doesn't work. The thing won't even turn on now. Funny thing is when you go to amazon to get in contact with the manufacture the link takes you to a pluming website of some random business. Makes you think that they don't want you to get in contact with them. The thing was a joke. Honestly do not waste your time or money! If anyone from the company reads this, I would love for you to reach out to help make it right. Bought it in July and stopped working August.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick & Ashley Dillow

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. Perhaps they have updated the app, but I had none of the issues reported by other reviewers. I found the user interface in the app to be very clear and easy to use, and have encountered no bugs. The device itself connected right up on the first try, which is more than I can say for some other devices that I've had experience with trying to set up via Bluetooth to get them connected to the WiFi. My experience in this regard with this particular product has been the smoothest I've ever had. It only took 5 minutes to get connected, update the firmware, and start configuring the device. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: David M. Weprin

customer_reviews.title: App is buggy; installation is a pain.
customer_reviews.text: First, the instruction is short and unclear. It only provides the plug-and-play instructions while it is absolutely not a P&P device. The app is very buggy and includes half a dozen "Paid" options like weather information, smart watering and etc. The firmware update was required and never got past "connecting". I tried to update the firmware again and my device was gone and can't be reset. The on/off button doesn't reset after "press it 5 times". I returned the item.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C Wang

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work.
customer_reviews.text: I guess the whole point of purchasing this would be to control the Faucet from your phone. I constantly have to reset the wifi. It works. Then the next day... it's offline. I need to reset again. It's a good idea, but the app is poorly designed and the faucet will not stay connected to wifi. I don't have any issues with wifi in my home. Sonos, Hue, etc. All work great! But this thing... just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stemo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these units in June of 2019 and now only 1 is working. In March of 2020 I discovered the gasket for the battery tray of one unit had failed and it was full of water and rust. In May of 2020 another unit started leaking from the device side of the inlet. I've been unable to reach their customer support. Their website's contact us page doesn't have the B-Hyve produce listed so I can't even get to a form, email address, or phone number.
customer_reviews.author: R.P.

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement. Dies in under 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Love the convenience of this device. It shuts down when rain detected in forecast. Remote access to control via internet. Purchased mine August 2019, placed out last two weeks, last week app notified it lost connection. Tried to reconnect this weekend but no luck. Changed battery and tried again but no success. I am very disappointed in the durability of product. Did not last the warranty period and I am now without a timer as we begin the season when it is needed, only used for 3 months. I have reached out to support for instructions and warranty replace but have not received a response. I will update if I ever receive a response.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would make life easier, but the aggravation of trying to get it set up has been more than frustrating! I spent the last hour restarting my phone and resetting, and de-authorizing the devices. I needed to do a firmware update and it locked up my phone. It keeps telling me it needs a firmware update and I click on it and it says it's up to date. But I still can't pair anything. I've unplugged it and taken the batteries out, and I'll attempt to deal with it again later. I'll update later if I manage to get this thing set up but it still goes without saying, this has been very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Matsikay

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your time and money
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple issues with this device. Setup is difficult. Out of a brand new box, the app told me the timer is registered to another user. Their website said that may be relayed to setup. The instructions to resolve that are outdated and don’t match the app. So basically they are useless. It said to call customer support. I did and they’re closed on Sunday. Understandable but disappointing. Also, the instructions in the app don’t match the interface. So that makes it more difficult. Needless to say, I’ll turn the water on with my hand and save $75.
customer_reviews.author: mperu0608

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. The only wish is, I wish a single box can have more than 1 zone. i.e watering more than one area of garden or lawn at different days and times. For this type of application, you need separate hose timers. Customer service is very helpful and knowledgeable. The rain delay feature needs tweaking because timer still operates after rainfall under 24hrs window. But the other times I have picked up on the rain and automatically set a rain delay on their own. Will follow up with tech support. Very easy to setup with wi-fi etc. You only need 1 hub which supports up to six timers as per tech support.
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS C RAMDAWAH

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to the b-hyve controller family
customer_reviews.text: These hose end controllers provide full irrigation automation within the b-hyve family. These controllers are integrated into the b-hyve app which provides a common look and feel for your homes irrigation requirements. I use 4 of these and an Orbit in ground 12 station controller. My furtherest placed controller is approx 125’ from its Bluetooth hub and works perfectly. All controllers on a particular hub participate in their Bluetooth mesh network which provides long reaches. My only suggestion has been voiced before, having the h-hyve app provide irrigation times synchronized across all devices.
customer_reviews.author: Jack_De

customer_reviews.title: No Factory Reset - if you interrupt pairing, your hub is bricked
customer_reviews.text: There is NO FACTORY RESET!!! If you interrupt your pairing process because your phone screen turns off, there is NO way to find the hub again. There is NO phone support on weekends, there is no live chat, no email support. The forums indicate if your hub gets disconnected the only recourse you have is to write a forum post, have one of the support people see it, then remove your device from your account a few days later and try again. There is NO factory reset on the hub. You can brick your device by pausing the pairing process. That's incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W.

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: Now, I cannot attest to the longevity of the hardware but I set it up 2 days ago and works beautifully including the app. I'm not currently using it to water my lawn but have permanently installed it in my pool re-fill line to top off the pool's evaporated water. Awesome to know that I can do this from anywhere since we travel a lot. Works flawless with Alexa as well.. and the price? Just right! Good job Orbit! As good as anything out there if not better than most.. now, will it last? We shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Teamdoc

customer_reviews.title: Technology headed in the right direction
customer_reviews.text: I think these units could use some improvement, but overall they are a step in the right direction for the technology. They are easy to install and understand. The app user interface is horrible. They took a lazy route and made one application for both their irrigation system controller and individual hose devices. The zones for the individual devices make no sense. Also, the "smart watering" isn't very useful on the individual devices when used for sprinklers that you move around the yard. Overall I love them. Would love to see them integrate with Google/Nest more.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Hirons

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay powered on or connected to the wifi
customer_reviews.text: This is being returned tomorrow. The hub connected easily to my wifi. When I attached the timer unit to the faucet, the timer unit would NOT stay powered on except to manual free flow. When I was able to get the manual watering turned off, the unit itself would not stay powered on. Then the hub kept disconnecting from the wifi. After almost two hours of frustration...back into the box and back it will go. Great concept, piss poor execution. BTW...my wifi is not an issue with ANY other outdoor unit. Just this one. Thanks but no thanks. Maybe when the execution portion of the units is improved but a worthless piece of plastic the way it is.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to make it easier to water plants behind house which does not have an outlet in back. Set up and tried it out. Seems to restrict water flow. Water pressure from hose is nowhere near what it is when not using the device. Stopped working after a month. Very disappointed. Went thru 3 batteries in one month.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use.  Apparently, they listened and fixed earlier issues.
customer_reviews.text: Clearly, they had issues with earlier versions of their app, as noted by reviews back in 2018, etc. We just installed it this past week (android phone) and it was a BREEZE. Throughout the entire process the App steps you through the whole process. All said - maybe 10 min total? The smart watering stuff looks very impressive, but we have yet to see how well it works in practice. The manual watering mode is EZ - and there are multiple profiles that one can setup. Solid stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K

customer_reviews.title: Wow - customer service is bad.
customer_reviews.text: The devices would not connect to the Orbit server since they were paired to a different account (presumably an Amazon return). I was instructed on the App to call Orbit. I did, but the phone service directs you to the website and only lets you speak to a customer service rep after going through a series of hoops. Even then, you have to wait about 3 hours to speak with an operator who is not very helpful. Not a good user experience....
customer_reviews.author: MSK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent concept minus the execution
customer_reviews.text: Got my valve in, installed it, powered it up and followed the instructions on the app. Started the firmware update and got the white light of death. Unit no longer responds to the 5 button presses or anything else for that matter. Hit up the eenternets and found a bunch of people with my problem with no real solutions. Might as well had been dead on arrival because that's how much use I got out of it. So, uninstalled it, placed it back in its package and I'm sending it back tomorrow. Thanks b-hyve.
customer_reviews.author: dd

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, hard-to-use software
customer_reviews.text: The physical unit works great, appears sturdy, and has not failed in a couple month's of use. The app, OTOH, is non-intuitive, hard to use, and contains no useful help functions. Tech support is non-existent. I work in the tech industry, specifically with smartphone apps, and this is among the worst I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Luoma

customer_reviews.title: Almost there...
customer_reviews.text: Based on reviews this device was a perfect fit for my raised beds. Thank goodness I own an ipad because my new S10 with android 10 will not work with the bhyve. Orbit support agrees with my assessment. Does not support Android 10. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Long Time Gone

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating. Works about 20% of the time. Constant restarts to get it to work.
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating. It links up about 20% of the time. Constant re starts of the program to get the blue tooth to link back up. I've read and done all the recommended fixes that date back to 2018 and it still malfunctions. These are the screenshots I see 80% of the time. More like 90% actually.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Scratchley

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a strong wifi connection
customer_reviews.text: I'm a tech nerd and really like this gadget. I setup a drip line to garden and have this water every morning. Twice it detected it was going to rain from internet weather and didn't turn the water on those days. I found the app easy enough to navigate though haven't messed with smart watering as I have lots of types of plants on the same line. I adjust the output of the water from the various types of drip line connections. I can be out in the garden and use my phone to turn it on test for 5 minutes and adjust various spray heads. Saves time walking back and forth to turn hose off manually.
customer_reviews.author: Positronic

customer_reviews.title: Two star for good idea and product/hardware design... one star each
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on July 8, 2018. It worked for about one month with some minor connection problem. It was very frustrating to deal with very very unintuitive app interface. After one month it will only connect using bluetooth, no wifi connection... and then it died. Can not connect iphone app to device. Tried many times, followed their online instruction. Would like to return but its out of return window. P.S. read last few sentences of this review two or more time and it sounds like poem... or may be its just me :)
customer_reviews.author: Manan

customer_reviews.title: Water Hammer
customer_reviews.text: The product can be tuned to water lawns and a gardens on an as needed basis. Set up is relatively easy but there were some issues with set-up hanging. The android application works adequately but I don't consider it intuitive. The web application didn't work for me, but I gave up on it relatively quickly. The water valve closes rapidly which causes water hammer in my house piping. Adding water hammer arrestors reduced, but did not eliminate the water hammer. Recently some of the valves dropped it wireless connection and started watering the lawn. The valve had to be power cycled to reset and regain control. The system appears to be operating properly for once again;
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Easy to install, Saves your plants!
customer_reviews.text: Love having these installed for our plants that our in containers. Have one feeding a large window box, one feeding a large pot on the front porch and one feeding a large barrel of herb plants and a tomato plant in the back. All are working off one hub wifi unit. Two have worked flawlessly, one had to be reset once, but has been working fine since that time. I have had one unit going on the 2nd year and the other two were purchased in Spring of 2019. If you can run small irrigation hoses discreetly, these work great. I assume they would work great for traditional garden hoses as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to smart home
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient and a great idea product. Nice features and works as expected. Four stars only due to an initial hiccup with Android setup (had to switch to iOS and that worked fine) and the fact that Smart mode relies on a somewhat faulty algorithm for watering, the system thought not to water for almost a week due to upcoming rain even though chances of the rain were little (and in fact, it did not rain at all in my area). Adding manual mode ensured grass was watered and avoided any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad Kofman

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love the ability to set a schedule for watering. We are in a drought right now and this has come in handy. It can use 'smart watering' to automatically water the area. I did have an issue connecting a second timer. I was expecting ti to be 2 different zones (ie. Zone 1 and Zone 2). This is not the case. Once connected, you can switch between the 'active' device by tapping the top of the home page. The instructions aren't very clear on that. Other than that, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several other timers and they would work sometimes. These timers work all the time. I had a lot of problems getting the firmware updated (the app needed to be updated) and then programming them was a bit of a challenge. You're on your own because the tech support is LOUSY! I really like the ability to control these valves over my home network. They are expensive (I did find them for $33 each) but if you only one or two it's not a real issue.
customer_reviews.author: Curt in GA

customer_reviews.title: Great for filling a pool occasionally on a schedule.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Instructions must have been updated because they were very easy to follow. I have the device hooked up mid way on a 35 ft brick wall. Bluetooth reaches the wifi bridge about 20 ft away with no issue. Wish the connectors were brass instead of plastic. I am using this as a remotely operated, weather aware, timed and scheduled pool filler upper. Beats laying a hose across the deck to a float valve device. Just added a hose and a stainless fountain nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: ReagansDad

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device
customer_reviews.text: Just finished my first watering with this device and I couldn’t be happier. The set up was quick and the interface on the app is user friendly. I would suggest pairing the timer inside your house, right next to the hub, before bringing it outside to test. It was nearly an immediate pairing plus it ran the necessary firmware updates in less than 5 minutes. I’m having fun watching the weather and the timer on the app as well. Will probably add two or three more timers and connect them to the hub in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M Croft

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a wifi hose timer
customer_reviews.text: It takes some learning how to set up but you can do a lot with these things. I like that it will give you a flow rate. while it tries to pull the weather down to adjust watering based on weather readings and forecast, unless you have a weather station on your street, I didn't find that it predicts accurately the actual amount applied. It is still useful to set a rain delay though. You can also use it to remotely turn on for manual watering too. You can run four hoses off one unit with a manifold.
customer_reviews.author: H. wrightTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these. My only issue was upon installation. During the install after adding the 1st device the app just hung. I had to restart my phone. After doing so the device was installed. Adding the other 2 devices were very easy without any issues. Very easy to use. Just like with any new piece of software you have to get used to navigating the app. Glad i didn't listen to the negative reviews. We have a large yard and this makes watering the grass painless
customer_reviews.author: Bnard

customer_reviews.title: Lethal to all living things. This will kill everything you are trying to grow.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Relying on this killed my entire garden. Has a supposed notification if there's a malfunction, but it doesn't work either. So, no functioning, and no notification. You are far better off just getting a regular old school manual timer and saving a ton of money as well as all your hard earned work that will kill your entire garden with this piece of junk. Far worse than useless. Very detrimental and lethal to all living things.
customer_reviews.author: Magnum

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most horrible product ever! The app sucks, it never picks up the product on WiFi or will randomly disconnect and not tell you. In fact it doesn’t tell you if it’s even connected. The hose timer won’t connect to the hub or the app, won’t run anything from the app no matter how many times you disconnect and reconnect it, terrible customer service. No one answers you, no one responds to live chat either.... there app is poorly designed and overall don’t waste your time or money. It’s a great idea... if it worked....
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: What's that banging!
customer_reviews.text: This system works well. The application is near perfect for the needs and the interface is easy to use. The issue is that the internal valve is very quick. When this unit turns off the water you'll surely know due to the loud BANG. I'm sure some folks are aware of what water hammer is, but this is a whole new level of concern. I could hear he water on this unit turn off from two floors above. My home is on a well and we have ~40-50 at the pump ~25 from the water tank, I can only imagine what sounds would come if we have city pressure ~40PSI+...
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for to automatically water our plants along the sides of house. I had used manual timers which worked fine until it rained. Then I had to go out and turn them off. If we were away from home on vacation, I had to turn the manual times completely off or leave them on and wind up over watering. Costly. The B-hyves are easy to install and use with the app. I now let it water automatically using the weather to dictate how often it should turn on and water. I can also turn it on or off using the app without ever going outside.
customer_reviews.author: PLJ

customer_reviews.title: Bad unit but good ending
customer_reviews.text: I bought a single unit (Bluetooth) The unit run for about one week and broke. (Batteries run dead in 10 minutes) Call the service (The only way is true messenger or true the forum) Prompt response after few minutes the sent me another units. Excellent service. (I was afraid since i live in Canada and many US company don't want to send unit to Canada) It took 5 days !) My comment is : 1- The batterie last only few weeks so get a lots of AA for the summer. 2- The application could be simpler and better but i does the job. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Michel

customer_reviews.title: And it was working so well!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I liked these. Bought 2. Relatively easy to install. Worked for a few months, then one died. Pulled the battery compartment to do a reset and it had water inside. For the $70.00 I’d expect it to last more than 1/2 of a season. Major disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: CHM

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I tried two different hub/faucet sets on two different phones (iPhone and Android) with no luck. They would sometimes pair but lose connection quickly in the event they actually paired which was very rare. I tried both the standard and pro app which made no difference. One time I made it all the way to faucet calibration then it list connection, again. I am not new to tech or smart devices so I was pretty disappointed with these. The app/GUI looks nice but that's about it. I would do more research and get a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Product idea is great - customer support terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I have many automations in my home so I thought an automated hose system for my small lawn would be great. The app is rather complicated to use. Information is overwhelming and not easy to understand. THE CUSTOMER SUPPORT IS NON-EXISTENT! I was on hold for 20 minutes, I was prompted to leave my phone number for a call-back in 20minutes. NEVER HAPPENED. These babies are going back, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Yellowhat94

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my existing Orbit sprinkler control.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Orbit wifi connected sprinkler control box for a few years and this is the perfect companion to it. The phone app has always been a little confusing, but recent enhancements have made it much easier to understand. I have it connected to a stand alone sprinkler to cover an area just outside of my normal coverage. I can run it on a schedule or manually at any time. Nice addition to my system.
customer_reviews.author: James from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, great performance!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my garden, where I have a drip irrigation system. Attaches easily to the hose bib. picks up wifi about 100' from house, works smoothly. The App is good, but I wish they had more features directed towards a vegetable gardener. They focus on turf, flowers, trees and shrubs. I think they are missing a whole target market of people growing vegetables. I am a former user of the now defunct "Edyn" products, so I really miss having an app that targets tomatoes, beans and peppers! All that said, I'm looking forward to picking up another for my drip irrigation for hanging flower baskets.
customer_reviews.author: lapoljo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This was the third sprinkler timer I purchased, this one was high tech and twice as expensive. They all have one thing in common, they don't work. Downloaded everything according to the directions, hooked it up verified all times, connections, etc. Turned on the water and nothing. Tried to program but timer read "device is taking too long to respond. Went out later to disconnect it and the water was on (not according to any preset schedule), stayed on for 2 hours, I shut it off. Am returning it and will hire the neighbor boy to water the garden, will be more dependable and less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: David Root

customer_reviews.title: Bullet-proof product, updated app is much better
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hose timer to water our vegetable garden. We just had a baby and I knew we would be at the hospital, and then busy and tired after and I didn't want to kill our garden in the process. Set up for the product was super simple and quick, I got everything working on the first try. At first, the app was a little bit clunky, but they have a redesigned app which is very user-friendly, much more intuitive, and allows me to schedule waterings and do everything that I need to do very easily. I highly recommend this if you want to worry less about getting things watered in your yard.
customer_reviews.author: tysonkreid

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: We have an irrigation system for most of our yard, however we added some more beds with new landscaping. I was out there everyday watering all of the new plants during this drought we are having in the North East. It was aweful. Until... I get this item hook it up in about 10 minutes and woke up this morning to an alert telling me that my lawn and new landscaping has been watere for me. I could cry ! So happy with this purchase, thinking of getting more
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie M.

customer_reviews.title: Smart but weak.
customer_reviews.text: Great smart valve. Needs to be built a little stronger. It broke open 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: JKBen

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy so far
customer_reviews.text: You have to constantly reconnect via Bluetooth. Both timers didn't run at the scheduled time. Removed /added one timer. Today the one I had removed/added ran during the scheduled time. However the other one didn't and I was not able to connect via Bluetooth. I replaced the batteries, removed/added and setup another time schedule. I will follow up :) The system seems to be better after removing/adding all the timers. They ran as expected at the correct time.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca McAllister

customer_reviews.title: One major flaw
customer_reviews.text: I like that you can control this from your phone. I also like how it has the ability to skip days when rain is eminent. I don’t like the fact that two separate units can’t work independently of each other. I’ve read online that this is a feature they are prioritizing. Because I can’t control them independently of each other I use my old cheap timer and one of these. Note: you can manually turn each one on, independent of the other. However, the units must run on the same schedule. That doesn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed defective flawed devices
customer_reviews.text: Bad product, I gave bhyve two chances and it was very time consuming, but the product is defective. The first unit I sent back because the faucet timer only worked on bluetooth and could not be controlled by the hub. The second unit, the hub would not connect to my router even after full resetting and cycling of all equipment. Orbit should stop selling this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Techelect

customer_reviews.title: The Orbit B-Hyve has to be my favorite home automation system
customer_reviews.text: The Orbit B-Hyve has to be my favorite home automation system. We have 2 manicured acres with 4 of the 12 station controllers and 1 of the smart hose timers (soon to be 3 hose timers). The app is easy to operate, and the system works like a charm - every time.... all day, every day for almost a year now. If you're not using smart sprinkler controls you're missing out.
customer_reviews.author: Parish

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect, use and you can manage via phone!
customer_reviews.text: My old one broken after couple years, and leave me a chance to replace w/ this one. First of all, easy to get things connected. It takes me about 15mins to setup wifi, connect to watering system, and testing via phone. Build-in smart watering function seems a little bit difficult for me to understand and use. But manual watering works perfectly, and able to manage via phone (no mater where you are, as long as your phone connected to internet). The only downside is no battery included, 2 AA batteries needed to get it up & running, so keep this in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Xu

customer_reviews.title: Creates a water hammering issue
customer_reviews.text: Terrible app aside (which has been covered already in other reviews), and on top of really bad "smart watering" (during a week with no rain and 90 degree weather it doesn't want to water at all), the valves on these close so abruptly that they cause water hammering, badly. No thanks on risking damage to my pipes for the sake of having these (not like they are really doing what I want anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Ah.....Automation!
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit worried on setup based on previous reviews. But it’s Amazon with free returns if I wasn’t happy. Setup was very straight forward and worked perfectly. Ensure you have good internet connection when setting up and the right distance for Bluetooth. The app could use some improvements as it was somewhat confusing at first but figured out their process within 5 minutes. Works well!!
customer_reviews.author: Jon V. Estrella

customer_reviews.title: Can't find device
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this to work, setup was easy to start with, got the hub connected to the wifi. Then I ran to the store to get batteries, got back 20 minutes later, installed the faucet timer, opened the the app and it brought me back to the initial startup program. This time it couldn't find the hub, tried to re-pair it to the wifi, never could get the hub to be recognized again. The hub was running really hot as well. Great idea but poor implementation and software. For the price it should just work.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool once it is setup
customer_reviews.text: I have 20 years programming experience and I am a techie. It took me about 30 mins to get this setup and then updated. That is why this is a 4 star product. Once the unit and the hub were configured and setup for my yard, this thing is amazing! It automatically handles watering based on the lawn and soil type. If they would just fix the initial setup this would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: TechEagle_AC

customer_reviews.title: up and running in 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Received today - installed app - had faucet up and running on my iphone app in 5 minutes - then added the skill to Alexa and another minute later i had 100% control of this hose bib - not sure what all the issues were by other reviewers on here with an interface issue but i find the app, connection, reliability and functionality of the valve flawless
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, Easy, Saved My Garden
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant! So easy to use, program, and update. I love the rain delay feature and the ability to override it if the weather forecast is wrong. This absolutely saved my garden!!! I was able to hook up two sprinklers to water my entire garden during the heat of the summer. Something that took me at least an hour to do manually! Next year, irrigation with this timer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gwen K

customer_reviews.title: Hard to set up
customer_reviews.text: I ran into a lot of problems trying to get this set up. First off the firmware was outdated and the unit would not factory reset after updating. Online support and in-app support are a joke. Finally found a phone number to call with a 45 min wait (during COVID 19). After unplugging everything, restarting my phone, and finally getting everything to factory reset I was able to get the product working as I was waiting on hold for support. Now that the product is working I do like it and it works great just frustrated at my hr of setup this morning.
customer_reviews.author: risen

customer_reviews.title: I almost did not purchase this because of the bad reviews. Setup was quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: This is only day one so this may change over the next few weeks. I almost did not purchase this because of the bad reviews. Setup was quick and easy. I did a quick test and it all seems to work - it might change - but so far so good The app is a little confusing I agree - but it all seems to work and that is the important thing
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Concept is great, doesn't always work well
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot to like about this product, starting with syncing with the weather. As someone replacing some grass with seed - it is nice to be able to set it for 10 minutes twice a day and water the grass. It doesn't sync well with wifi often despite it being less than 10 feet from the wifi access point. I am also not a fan of the override feature on the device which sort of works. It has a purpose but I will be taking it off once the grass is tall enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle H.

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Watering
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard that needed to be watered, but did not need a whole sprinkler system. This was easy to set uo and can water when I want or I can schedule the watering just with a faucet. You can use a garden hose, but I opted with a tube connecting 4 pop up sprinklers. I can use my iPhone to water, so I don't have to be there to turn on. Also, it has a rain sensor built in, so it saves water on rainy days while you are away.
customer_reviews.author: Allen P. Huntington

customer_reviews.title: This is a great controller
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and easy to use. With WiFi smartphone control it will communicate with you and you can control it wherever you are in the world. Building in the schedules is intuitive and they work flawlessly. I have three trees in pots that have to be watered separately from my main irrigation system; and the B-hyve Smart Hose Faucet Timer with Wi-Fi Hub is the perfect answer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Software is terrible, making this product a bad choice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three hose WiFi enabled hose devices, one with a plug in hub. Setup and installation pretty straight forward but where the product falls apart for me was trying to program the units to work with the frustrating software. I will update this as I continue to work with the devices. I would not recommend this because of this problem.
customer_reviews.author: TDM

customer_reviews.title: Works, sometimes!
customer_reviews.text: I have found it to be erratic. At first (when the hub and device were about 59’ apart) when I tried to start watering it worked 50% of the time. After a call to tech support I moved the hub closer and now it responds 75% if the time. It is unclear whether my iphone needs to be on the same wifi network as the hub. Be prepared for some learning pains.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Burns

customer_reviews.title: The Product is Truly Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know who could have a bad thing to say about this product. I had it installed and programmed in 15 minutes. Don’t know about durability yet but it works perfectly. All I can say is I don’t know where this has been all my life but I am crazy happy I have it now. Worth every penny and more. I had SO many others that were the same price and offered 20% of the functionality or less and their durability was terrible, not even a month with most.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Kromer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth my time
customer_reviews.text: In a nutshell the hardware may be ok but I never got to use it because the software is faulty. I was never able to get the device completely setup. After many hours trying and no success reaching tech support I decided it was not worth my time to continue. I really do not think it is ready to meet the needs of those who want a device like this. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JojoT

customer_reviews.title: Using for my pool drain valve
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up as a valve to drain my pool. Works flawlessly! I can remotely turn on my pool pump and then set this on with a 0 to 4 hour timer. Price is great compared to other options. Very happy. Update: valve turns on on it's own. I do not have any program selected. Very disappointed. Online search shows this is a common issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Generally pleased with this device
customer_reviews.text: Generally pleased with this device, which performs as expected. The app is a little bit difficult, but on par with many other upstart smarthome products. It's usable, and I expect that it will continue to improve as sister products are released. It's great for small-to-medium-sized areas - for example, the flower bed that you water daily with a soaker hose, and never disconnect. I wish there weren't a hub, but it's a minor quibble. Overall, a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Liotta

customer_reviews.title: Fundamentally flawed
customer_reviews.text: There is a deep, fundamental flaw with this product. If you have more than one unit, they cannot properly be linked together to create zones for your yard. So all of the smart watering features only work if you have just one unit. You can manually program each unit separately but at that point you’re just paying a steep premium for a manual hose timer that can be accessed via the Internet. It seems to me that this potentially could be fixed by a software so I have high hopes that I couldn’t upgrade this review in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jay O'Meara

customer_reviews.title: Multiple timers doesn’t mean multiple zones.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these initially and wanted to add another zone. The unit itself was not in stock so I bought the full package again for a few bucks more. I added it to my current hub and found out it doesn’t work as an additional zone. You have to switch between timers in the app which is a little annoying but I only water manually so it’s not too bad. Strange they overlooked this.
customer_reviews.author: daniel Potter

customer_reviews.title: Not as reliable as I’d hoped
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as “simple” hose timer for watering the lawn. Pretty straightforward to install and connect to the house network, however, the connection between the hub and faucet mounted B-hyve unit frequently drops and I have to reinstall and reconnect on almost every use. The hub is located on a plug that is on an inside wall no more than 3 feet from the B-hyve unit on the outside wall. Have tried moving to another plug that is about 3 feet the other side of the unit and still have connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B

customer_reviews.title: Absolute piece of trash
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. Everything about this product screams 'we don't know what we're doing' by Orbit. The user interface GUI is trash, the lack of connectivity to google home is trash, the solenoid stopped working altogether after only 4 months which means it is trash.. overall it is a flimsy piece of trash that is cheaply made, horribly programmed, and severely overpriced. Don't buy it. You'll thank me. I hate this product and wish I knew better before buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Rell

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This thing failed the first week I had it. Their customer service sent me a replacement. That one worked for 2 weeks, then today it turned on and stayed on for 4 hours while using the smart watering feature. It was only supposed to run for 15 minutes, but it somehow lost connection and just kept watering. My garden is flooded and this thing is junk!
customer_reviews.author: Bert B.

customer_reviews.title: Once you get them installed...they are very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Once you get them installed. The directions were not very intuitive. I spent all afternoon screwing with the darned things before I came upon a web forum that showed you how to completely reset them. Once I found that it, it was a snap getting them going. Otherwise, they work very well. I have four of them. I've broken my yard up into four different zones and I have them set up to water each zone for 15 minutes 2x a day. They work flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Needs A LOT of work
customer_reviews.text: These always disconnect from wifi and i always have to use through bluetooth (so idk why i spent the extra money on the wifi) it will not work once i leave my house because you need to be connected to the same wifi or bluetooth. Needs a lot of work and was confusing on how to set up with the app and wouldnt let me set a Zone so i cant start a schedule.
customer_reviews.author: MrsHurst

customer_reviews.title: Great for one year then it broke
customer_reviews.text: This worked for a year only. The hose connection part broke by the second year. No light coming on to show it has power and it won’t pair with the hub, despite trying multiple sets of brand new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Elizabeth Blomberg

customer_reviews.title: The best for worried free watering
customer_reviews.text: I like this product specialty when I'm not home to care for the plants and garden. I's easy to use, the program works great. I can control it with my cell phone from anywhere. Very accurate. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Sand
